projects.title: Lana Del Rey Dashboard
projects.description:
The Lana Del Rey Dashboard is an interactive data and design project that explores Lana Del Rey‚Äôs music, discography, and artistic evolution through a structured dashboard experience.

The project focuses on transforming music-related data into a visually cohesive and easy-to-navigate interface, inspired by Lana Del Rey‚Äôs cinematic, nostalgic, and melancholic aesthetic. The dashboard presents her body of work in a way that is both informative and visually engaging, allowing users to explore:

üéµ Albums, songs, and release timelines across different eras
üìä Trends and patterns within her discography, including releases and musical output over time
üé® Aesthetic-driven visuals inspired by Lana Del Rey‚Äôs imagery and mood
üìÅ Organized views of music data for intuitive exploration and comparison

This project emphasizes frontend development, data presentation, and visual storytelling, demonstrating how structured data can be transformed into a calm, immersive dashboard experience.

Frontend: React + TypeScript + Next.js for a responsive, dashboard-style user interface.
Data Handling: Structured music metadata processed and displayed through reusable components.
UI Design: Clean layouts and visual hierarchy inspired by Lana Del Rey‚Äôs artistic themes.
Deployment: Hosted on Vercel for fast, scalable performance.
projects.headline: Exploring Lana Del Rey Through Data & Design

projects.title: Bed Bath & Beyond
projects.headline: üõ†Ô∏è Bed Bath & Beyond Retail R Shiny Dashboard (ETW2001)
projects.description:
The Bed Bath & Beyond Dashboard is an interactive data visualization project developed using R Shiny, focused on exploring retail and product-related data through a dynamic, user-driven dashboard.

This project simulates a real-world retail analytics scenario by organizing and presenting Bed Bath & Beyond data in a clear and structured interface. The dashboard allows users to interactively explore key aspects of the business, supporting better understanding of trends and patterns through visual analytics. Key features of the dashboard include:

üõí Overview of product categories and assortments
üì¶ Interactive analysis of inventory, pricing, and product distribution
üìä Visual exploration of trends and patterns across retail data
üîç User-controlled filters and inputs for dynamic data exploration

The project emphasizes the use of R Shiny for building reactive web applications, demonstrating how statistical data and business information can be transformed into an accessible, interactive dashboard suitable for decision support.

Framework: R Shiny for interactive web-based dashboards.
Data Processing: R (dplyr, tidyr) for data cleaning, transformation, and aggregation.
Visualization: ggplot2 and Shiny UI components for clear and responsive charts.
Interactivity: Reactive inputs and server logic to enable real-time data updates.
Deployment: Hosted as a Shiny application for easy access and demonstration

projects.title: Team Swordfish
projects.headline: Canadian CanSat üöÄ Design Challenge
projects.description: In the CanSat Design Challenge held in Lethbridge, Alberta, our team designed a satellite the size of a pop can, which was launched by high-powered amateur rockets (or carried by a drone) to a height of up to one kilometer. During its descent, our CanSat conducted experiments using Terrain Relative Navigation to precisely track its position and attitude, utilizing only an onboard camera and an inertial navigation system. This technology is essential in environments where GPS is unavailable, such as the Moon. The embedded software uses C/C++ and a finite state machine to manage the CanSat's operational states (Idle, Data Acquisition, Touchdown). Our innovative approach earned us the Best Technical and Best Scientific Mission awards at the competition. Following our success, we were invited to appear on the show "Ask an Astronomer."

projects.title: Mortgage Payment Calculator
projects.headline: üè† Internship at RBC - Summer 2024
projects.description:
During my internship at RBC, my team led the development of a mortgage payment calculation web application designed to assist over 180,000 clients in selecting optimal mortgage payment options based on various inputs. This solution featured dynamic payment calculations and was integrated with a new mortgage renewal tool, providing a seamless one-click experience for clients to choose better rates and payment options.

Utilized Angular and an in-house RBC design system (RIG) for the responsive frontend, while the backend was powered by Java and Spring Boot to handle complex calculations and business logic. The application was deployed to the UAT environment using OpenShift 4 and Jenkins, following CI/CD best practices for smooth releases.

projects.title: YRHacks
projects.headline: Offical YRDSB Hackathon
projects.description:
Lead Organizer of 2 iterations (YRHacks 4 & 5) and Executive of YRHacks 3 - YRHacks is the official annual hackathon of the York Region District School
Board, supported by the Specialist High Skills Major (SHSM) program. Our
mission is to create a welcoming and exciting hackathon experience for high
school students of all strengths and skill levels. We facilitate participants to
gather in teams to create projects, as well as attend workshops and social
gatherings.
YRHacks is an environment for students to come together and experiment with
their creative ideas. Each year we welcome around 300 students to our hackathon.

projects.title: Signematic
projects.headline: 2nd Place üèÜ at JAMHacks 8
projects.description: JAMHacks is one of Canada's largest high school hackathons based out of the University of Waterloo with 150+ high school hackers. Our submission, Signematic, aims to provide live sign language transcription for videos and movies using advanced machine-learning algorithms and gesture models. Our solution ensures that the deaf and hard-of-hearing community can enjoy a seamless viewing experience with accurate and real-time sign language interpretation.

projects.title: TrackBack
projects.headline: Memory Assistant for Seniors with Dementia
projects.description: TrackBack helps seniors navigate memory loss by leveraging object detection with YOLOv4 to track and log everyday items. Users can search for misplaced objects through a conversational web app interface powered by Voiceflow's LLM, which retrieves the object's location, bounding box, and prominent color from recorded footage. TrackBack features an intuitive UI designed for ease of use by seniors, focusing on simple chat-based interactions.

projects.title: Codebuds
projects.headline: Non-Profit Organization  üå±
projects.description: Founder + Executive Director - Codebuds was an innovative non-profit organization, driven by a passionate team of young leaders who are committed to transforming the future of technology. Lead a team of 17 in writing a computing contest with 100+ attendees and hackathon with 70+ attendees. Built up platforms to reach 25,000+ students (10,000+ impressions on Instagram) with collaborations (i.e. attending Ignite Fair by Volunteer Toronto), and distributing $100,000+ worth of prizes within 4 months.

projects.title: "See"
projects.headline: Submission to Meta's Llama hackathon in Toronto
projects.description: "See" is an innovative AI-powered assistive tool designed to empower visually impaired individuals by providing seamless, voice-driven interaction with their surroundings. Leveraging Meta's Llama models and advanced context-aware technology, "See" offers a highly personalized experience through natural voice commands, auditory feedback, and offline functionality. It simplifies complex tasks like navigation, object recognition, and text reading, enabling users to gain independence and confidently explore the world with a single tap. Designed for accessibility and adaptability, "See" works across devices, breaking barriers and redefining inclusion for the blind community.

projects.title: CrisisControl
projects.headline: Solution to a GreenHouse issue
projects.description:
CrisisControl parses emergency disaster phone calls to improve dispatchers' accuracy and speed in assessing the situation and properly requisitioning emergency responders.

When a call is ended, the transcription of the call is parsed and analyzed to provide a concise overview for the dispatcher to review, verify, and dispatch responders, who receive a brief overview on their screens.

projects.title: Rhino's Quest
projects.headline: Platform Game with 3D Controller
projects.description:
You play as Racket the Rhino, an endangered Javan Rhino, who fights back against deforestation and shoots Awake‚Ñ¢ Bars at the humans invading his home with his trusty catapult. Navigate the levels with your custom-built controller in hand.

By advancing through multiple levels, fighting back against hordes of CS students, and discovering the evil prof's lab, you'll save the world and restore it to its natural order.

projects.title: VocalAI
projects.headline: Karaoke App
projects.description:
VocalAI includes two main features:

Karaoke Creation: Converts any song into a karaoke track that matches the original composition.
Speech Recognition & Pitch Scoring: Analyzes vocal delivery for accurate pronunciation and pitch, providing real-time feedback and scoring.
These tools offer personalized guidance and track progress to help improve singing abilities.

projects.title: Homework Run
projects.headline: Augmented Reality Game
projects.description: Homework Run is an augmented reality game that motivates players to stay active while dodging obstacles and answering trivia questions. By tracking body movements through the player's webcam, the game challenges users to avoid obstacles like cellphones and Instagram icons. Collisions prompt true-false questions on a chosen topic, adding an educational twist. The game uses OpenCV for motion detection, MediaPipe for pose tracking, and OpenAI's GPT-3.5 for generating trivia questions, creating a fun way to blend learning with physical activity.

projects.title: gotcha!
projects.headline: Pokemon Go for Humans
projects.description: gotcha! is a location-based web app that lets you ‚Äúcatch‚Äù people nearby (not Pok√©mon, but real humans). When two users are within close proximity, one can ‚Äúcatch‚Äù the other with a single tap. The person who is caught then receives a personalized SMS message prompting them to view the catcher‚Äôs profile and start a conversation with custom ice breakers based on their shared interests.

projects.title: Bayview StuCo
projects.headline: My School's Student Council
projects.description: I first joined the council in grade 9 and I've been re-elected to basically the same position ever since. My role has always been spearheading the outreach team, and much of my attention was always spent on the school website. Many of my best high school experiences from grade 9 all the way to grade 12 have been from serving in student council, representing 2100+ students.
